featured.text: Terrence Power, for example, complained that after his wife learned she had Wegener’s disease, an uncommon disorder of the immune system, they found it difficult to refuse testing recommended by her physician.
The cook’s plan to stop the dinner guest from complaining did not turn out as he had planned.
The team complained that its leader always took the ______ for all the hard work done by the team members.
The bus driver often complains about chewing gum found under passenger seats because it is and very hard to remove.

other.text: The cook sliced some potatoes thinner than before and prepared them for the complaining guest.
The man replied that he was very ___(33)__ about it, but people often complained that other people’s legs were always in the ___(34)__.

definition.zh_def: 抱怨，表達不滿或不快的情緒。
definition.en_def: To express dissatisfaction or annoyance about something.
definition.example: She decided to complain to the manager about the poor service.
